intro: Stephanocoma incana, commonly known as the Desert Evening Primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. Stephanocoma incana is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and desert scrub habitats.
